specifications.title: Admin Console And Ui
specifications.description: Dashboard customization through namespace-bounded asset libraries. Storage systems for branding resources, layout templates, and interactive widgets. Catalog organization with system object references tracking modification history and deployment status. Schema enforcement ensuring configuration validity across tenant hierarchies and environment boundaries.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Static UI components and console assets.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Namespace-scoped visual elements with versioning. Custom widget deployment and catalog management for portal surfaces.

specifications.title: Ai Services
specifications.description: Query handling through inference routing with production and test modes. Positive and negative quality markers with detailed categorization capture assistant performance. Streaming connections support authenticated access, subscription lifecycles, and feature flags. IP provisioning services allocate infrastructure resources for model workloads across distributed systems.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: AI assistant queries and feedback collection.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Natural language processing with quality signals and anomaly monitoring. Token authentication for data stream subscriptions.

specifications.title: Api
specifications.description: Structured classification systems with versioning support for contract evolution. Hierarchical groupings segment resources by operational role or security boundaries. Behavioral verification confirms authentication flows and permission constraints. Token and key safeguards protect sensitive credentials. Traffic inspection through connected load balancers and firewalls enables threat detection at network perimeters.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Interface definitions, schema validation, and grouping.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Resource cataloging with automatic classification and security profiling. Organizational hierarchies segment access by function or protection policy.

Contact types for billing notifications and tenant deletion workflows.

specifications.title: Blindfold
specifications.description: Public key retrieval and secret policy enforcement for encrypted data handling. Policy rules govern access with configurable matching and transformation actions. VoltShare integration provides decryption services, access counting, and audit log aggregation. Namespace-scoped policies enable fine-grained control over sensitive information with administrative overrides.

specifications.title: Bot And Threat Defense
specifications.description: Behavioral fingerprinting identifies automated clients through request patterns, mouse movements, and JavaScript execution. Threat categories classify attacks by type including credential stuffing, scraping, and denial-of-service. Defense instances apply per-namespace policies with configurable sensitivity thresholds and challenge actions. Provisioning handles integration credentials for third-party threat intelligence feeds.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Bot detection, threat categories, and defense instances.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Threat classification with behavioral analysis and signature matching. Automated blocking for malicious traffic patterns.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Configure bot defense instances per namespace
Manage TPM threat categories for classification
Provision API keys for automated defense systems

specifications.title: Cdn
specifications.description: Content delivery networks with edge caching, geographic distribution, and cache management. Supports custom rules, asset purge operations, and performance analytics. Enables worldwide asset distribution, optimization, and delivery monitoring across regions and protocols.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Content delivery and edge caching networks.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Global distribution with cache rules and purge operations. Performance monitoring and analytics.

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: cdn_loadbalancer
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Content delivery network load balancer for edge caching
relationship_hints: cdn_origin_pool: Origin servers for CDN content

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: cdn_origin_pool
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Origin server pool for CDN content sourcing

minimal.yaml:
metadata:
  name: cdn-basic
  namespace: default
spec:
  domains:
    - cdn.example.com
  origin_pool:
    - pool:
        name: origin-pool
        namespace: default

production.description: Production CDN with caching and compression
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: cdn-prod
  namespace: production
spec:
  domains:
    - cdn.example.com
    - assets.example.com
  https_auto_cert:
    add_hsts: true
  origin_pool:
    - pool:
        name: origin-pool
        namespace: production
  cache_settings:
    default_cache_action: CACHE
    cache_ttl_default: 86400
  compression_settings:
    content_types:
      - text/html
      - text/css
      - application/javascript
    enable_gzip: true

specifications.title: Ce Management
specifications.description: Customer edge node lifecycle through secure enrollment tokens and downloadable deployment images. Network connectivity options span exclusive, common, and administrative pathways with DHCP address pools supporting both IPv4 and IPv6. Bulk grouping consolidates configuration across distributed locations. Compatibility verification runs before software updates, with rollout tracking for version progression across the infrastructure.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Network interfaces, fleets, and site registration.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Token-based provisioning with image downloads and pre-upgrade validation. Fleet grouping enables bulk operations across distributed locations.

specifications.title: Certificates
specifications.description: X.509 certificate chains with intermediate and root CA support. Trusted CA list bundles for client authentication and mTLS validation. CRL distribution points and OCSP stapling configuration. Certificate manifests link credentials to load balancers and gateways. Automatic expiration tracking and renewal notifications.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Certificate chains and trusted CA bundles. Revocation list management and manifest configuration for PKI operations.

specifications.title: Cloud Infrastructure
specifications.description: Hyperscaler integration supporting Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform environments. Virtual network attachment workflows enable elastic compute provisioning with automatic reattachment capabilities. Edge authentication secrets for provider access. Segment telemetry and cross-region link reapplication for distributed deployments. Autonomous path synchronization across peered networks with real-time topology updates.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: AWS, Azure, GCP connectors and VPC attachments.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Multi-cloud provider connections with gateway peering and network path configuration. Credential vault integration and subnet enumeration.

specifications.title: Container Services
specifications.description: Namespaced isolation with configurable limits and autoscaling policies. vK8s abstracts operational overhead while providing scheduling, persistent storage, and service mesh integration. Compute profiles specify CPU, memory, and GPU allocations for reproducible environments. Telemetry tracks consumption patterns across geographically distributed infrastructure nodes.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Containerized workloads and virtual Kubernetes clusters.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Pod orchestration without full cluster complexity. Edge site execution, quota enforcement, and standardized compute profiles for distributed apps.

Manage container workloads with simplified orchestration
Run containerized applications without full K8s complexity

specifications.title: Data And Privacy Security
specifications.description: Pattern-based detection for personally identifiable information across request and response payloads. Custom data type definitions enable organization-specific classification beyond built-in PII categories. Regional log and metrics aggregation with Clickhouse, Elasticsearch, and Kafka export options. Geo-configuration policies enforce data residency requirements and jurisdiction-specific privacy regulations.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Sensitive data policies with custom classification rules. LMA region configuration and geo-based compliance controls.

specifications.title: Ddos
specifications.description: Network perimeter hardening through deny list configurations, rule group hierarchies, and encrypted tunnel endpoints. Attack signature detection identifies flood patterns while throttling mechanisms block anomalous traffic bursts. Tunnel health checks verify coverage across distributed segments. Priority ordering governs policy application for multi-layered screening approaches.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Volumetric attack mitigation and traffic scrubbing.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Deny lists, firewall rule groups, and tunnel-based safeguards. Rate limiting and pattern analysis for network perimeter security.

specifications.title: Dns
specifications.description: Name infrastructure with authoritative zones, A/AAAA/CNAME record types, and zone management. Supports zone transfers, security extensions, health-based routing, and delegation. Enables reliable name resolution, geographic load balancing, and name-based traffic steering across distributed environments.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Authoritative zones and record management.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Name resolution with zone transfers and health checks. Record types and delegation support.

common_workflows.name: Create DNS Domain
common_workflows.description: Configure DNS domain with load balancer backend

steps.command: Create load balancer endpoint first (virtual domain)

steps.description: Create DNS domain pointing to load balancer

solutions: Verify domain delegation to F5 XC nameservers
Check DNS domain configuration and backend load balancer status
Validate zone file and record configuration

minimal.description: Basic DNS zone with primary nameserver
minimal.yaml:
metadata:
  name: example-zone
  namespace: default
spec:
  primary:
    default_rr_set_group:
      - ttl: 300
        a_record:
          name: www
          values:
            - 192.168.1.100

production.description: Production DNS zone with SOA and multiple records
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: prod-zone
  namespace: production
spec:
  domain: example.com
  primary:
    soa_parameters:
      refresh: 3600
      retry: 600
      expire: 604800
      negative_ttl: 300
    default_rr_set_group:
      - ttl: 300
        a_record:
          name: www
          values:
            - 192.168.1.100
            - 192.168.1.101
      - ttl: 300
        cname_record:
          name: api
          value: www.example.com
      - ttl: 86400
        mx_record:
          name: ""
          values:
            - domain: mail.example.com
              priority: 10

specifications.title: Managed Kubernetes
specifications.description: Role-based access controls with cluster-scoped permissions and namespace bindings. Pod security admission levels enforce baseline, restricted, or privileged profiles. Container registry credentials support private image pulls across hybrid deployments. Policy rules define resource verbs, groups, and non-resource URL access patterns.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Cluster RBAC, pod security, and container registries.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Kubernetes role bindings and admission policies. Registry integration for EKS, AKS, and GKE workloads.

specifications.title: Marketplace
specifications.description: External connector infrastructure supporting direct, GRE, and encrypted tunnel modes with IKE parameter configuration and dead peer detection intervals. Cloud provider instances for Terraform automation and vendor partnerships. Service catalog entries with per-namespace activation flags, resource quotas, and administrative dashboard tile arrangement for operational workflows.

specifications.title: Network
specifications.description: Routing table manipulation via peer state machines and path selection algorithms. Secure conduits between locations using IKE handshakes, cipher suites, and key exchanges. Segment attachments bridge hybrid topologies spanning cloud providers and on-premises infrastructure. SRv6 addressing, CIDR block matching, and advertisement controls direct traffic flows across distributed deployments with granular policy enforcement.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: BGP peering, IPsec tunnels, and segment policies.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Border gateway protocol with ASN management and autonomous system relationships. Site-to-site VPN linking datacenters through encrypted channels.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Configure BGP routing and ASN management
Manage IPsec tunnels and IKE phases

specifications.title: Network Security
specifications.description: Perimeter defense through firewall configurations, address translation, and ingress/egress policies. Traffic steering directs packets according to defined criteria including origin, target, and service type. Segment boundaries create workload isolation zones while HTTP intermediaries manage client requests to external destinations. Port mappings employ static and dynamic address pools for flexible translation scenarios across multi-tenant environments.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: NAT policies, firewalls, and segment connections.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Firewall rules with routing decisions based on source, destination, or protocol. Segmentation isolates workloads while outbound proxies govern access.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Configure network firewall and ACL policies
Manage NAT policies and port forwarding

specifications.title: Nginx One
specifications.description: Dataplane server registration with health status tracking and location awareness. Service discovery bindings for dynamic upstream resolution. Cloud service gateway integration for hybrid deployments. WAF policy attachment and instance-level security controls.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: NGINX Plus instances and dataplane servers.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Instance discovery, WAF integration, and service mesh connectivity. Subscription lifecycle and configuration synchronization.

specifications.title: Object Storage
specifications.description: Blob management for application component delivery across namespaces. Time-limited download links with cryptographic signing protect asset retrieval. Version-controlled packages organized by operating system type support artifact discovery. Query filtering by name, type, and release number enables programmatic access to integrator libraries and protection modules for mobile deployments.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Mobile SDK assets, versioned binaries, and app shield files.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Versioned library distribution for mobile app integrators. Presigned URLs enable secure downloads with OS-specific builds for iOS and Android.

specifications.title: Observability
specifications.description: Telemetry systems execute scheduled availability checks from distributed AWS locations worldwide. Response code validation and timing metrics feed into historical trend analysis. DNS resolution accuracy verification ensures name service reliability. Certificate lifecycle tracking generates expiration warnings before outages occur. Regional probe distribution provides geographic coverage insights. Health summaries aggregate results into actionable dashboards with configurable alerting thresholds.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: HTTP availability probes with latency measurement. Certificate expiration alerts and global status dashboards for infrastructure health.

specifications.title: Rate Limiting
specifications.description: Threshold-based request blocking using sliding window calculations. Burst smoothing algorithms maintain sustained throughput without exceeding defined maximums. Per-connection controls apply granular restrictions by protocol type. Automatic block actions trigger when request counts surpass configured limits within specified intervals.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Request throttling, quotas, and policer rules.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Time-based quota enforcement with configurable windows in hours, minutes, or seconds. Protocol-specific controls for traffic shaping.

specifications.title: Secops And Incident Response
specifications.description: User threat assessment with configurable risk thresholds and mitigation rules. Detection covers high, medium, and low threat levels with corresponding actions like blocking, rate limiting, or alerting. Mitigation policies link to load balancers for real-time enforcement against identified bad actors.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Threat detection, user risk scoring, and automated blocking.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Malicious user mitigation with threat level classification. Automated response actions for suspicious behavior patterns.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Microservice routing and sidecar configuration.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Application type definitions with discovery and learned schema analysis. Traffic pattern inference for intelligent request handling.

specifications.title: Shape
specifications.description: Bot infrastructure policies with deployment tracking and subscription management. SafeAP protection against credential stuffing and account takeover. Mobile application shielding through SDK integration with OS-specific configurations. Real-time threat intelligence updates and automated response actions based on risk scoring and traffic patterns.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Threat recognition with behavioral analysis and device fingerprinting. Mobile SDK integration for application shielding.

specifications.title: Sites
specifications.description: Multi-cloud node provisioning spanning major public cloud environments including TGW, VNet, and VPC architectures. VPN tunnel configuration handles secure connectivity while IP prefix management controls address allocation. Customer edge deployments support external container orchestration platforms. Geographic distribution with resource sharing enables consistent policy enforcement across deployment points.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Cloud and edge node deployments.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: AWS, Azure, GCP VPC integration with transit gateways. Label-based selection for policy application across regions.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Deploy F5 XC across cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Manage XCKS (Managed Kubernetes) site deployments (formerly AppStack)
Deploy Secure Mesh sites for networking-focused edge deployments
Integrate external Kubernetes clusters as Customer Edge
Configure AWS VPC, Azure VNet, and GCP VPC sites
Manage virtual sites and site policies

specifications.title: Statistics
specifications.description: Alert policies with custom matchers, label groupings, and notification parameters. Log receivers for centralized collection with confirmation and verification workflows. Flow analytics, historical trend data, and namespace-scoped dashboards. Topology discovery and site-level health indicators for operational visibility.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Alerts, logs, flow analytics, and reporting.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Alerting policies with receiver integrations. Log aggregation, topology views, and site health tracking.

specifications.title: Support
specifications.description: Case management workflows including submission, commentary, and closure paths. Urgency adjustments and routing for time-sensitive incidents. Tax exemption verification requests. Site-level tcpdump operations‚Äîinitiation, enumeration, and termination‚Äîfor low-level network troubleshooting and protocol analysis.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Tickets, escalations, and network diagnostics.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Issue lifecycle with comments, severity changes, and resolution tracking. Packet capture for connection analysis.

specifications.description: APIs for configuring collection endpoints, metrics storage, and insight generation. Supports log aggregation, performance monitoring, and alerting integration across deployments.

specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Collection endpoints, metrics storage, and insight generation for observability workflows.

specifications.title: Tenant And Identity
specifications.description: Profile images and display customizations for personalized dashboard experiences. Federated authentication toggles controlling SSO behavior across organizational boundaries. Session lifecycle tracking with real-time visibility into active connections and timeout policies. Support ticket workflows including attachment handling and closure procedures for managed client escalations. Initial access provisioning sequences for new user onboarding.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: User profiles, sessions, and OTP settings.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Account view configurations and admin alert channels. One-time password resets, provisioning flows, and active connection monitoring.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Manage user profiles and notification preferences
Configure session controls and OTP settings

specifications.title: Threat Campaign
specifications.description: APIs for configuring detection policies and attack tracking. Supports campaign analysis, risk assessment, and automated mitigation rule generation across security domains.

specifications.title: Users
specifications.description: Token lifecycle governs automated site onboarding through cloud-init integration with configurable validity periods. Explicit category keys establish permitted classification hierarchies enforced across deployments. Inferred attributes attach automatically based on object characteristics and placement context. Namespace-scoped operations handle credential generation, revocation, and state transitions for streamlined provisioning workflows.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Account tokens, labels, and cloud-init config.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Site enrollment credentials with automatic expiration. Taxonomy keys define allowed categorization while auto-derived tags apply dynamically.

specifications.title: Virtual
specifications.description: Load balancing for HTTP, TCP, and UDP traffic with configurable routing rules and origin pool management. Supports health checks, session persistence, and automatic failover. Enables geographic distribution, rate limiting, and service policy enforcement across load balancers and routes.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: HTTP, TCP, UDP load balancing with origin pools.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Traffic distribution across regions with routing rules. Health checks and failover policies.
x-f5xc-use-cases: Define rate limiter and service policies
Manage malware protection and threat campaigns
Configure health checks and endpoint monitoring

Create HTTP load balancer pointing to origin pool

Check DNS configuration and domain propagation

minimal.description: Basic HTTP load balancer for quick testing
minimal.yaml:
metadata:
  name: my-lb
  namespace: default
spec:
  domains:
    - example.com
  http:
    port: 80
  default_route_pools:
    - pool:
        name: my-origin-pool
        namespace: default

production.description: Production-ready HTTP load balancer with TLS and WAF
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: prod-lb
  namespace: production
spec:
  domains:
    - api.example.com
  https_auto_cert:
    http_redirect: true
    add_hsts: true
    tls_config:
      min_version: TLS12
  app_firewall:
    name: default-waf
    namespace: shared
  default_route_pools:
    - pool:
        name: prod-origin-pool
        namespace: production
      weight: 100
  rate_limiter:
    total_number: 1000
    unit: MINUTE

advanced.description: Multi-origin load balancer with routing rules and rate limiting
advanced.yaml:
metadata:
  name: api-gateway
  namespace: production
spec:
  domains:
    - api.example.com
    - api-v2.example.com
  https_auto_cert:
    http_redirect: true
    add_hsts: true
  app_firewall:
    name: strict-waf
    namespace: shared
  routes:
    - match:
        path:
          prefix: /api/v1
      route_destination:
        destinations:
          - cluster:
              name: v1-backend
            weight: 100
    - match:
        path:
          prefix: /api/v2
      route_destination:
        destinations:
          - cluster:
              name: v2-backend
            weight: 100
  default_route_pools:
    - pool:
        name: default-backend
        namespace: production
  rate_limiter:
    total_number: 5000
    unit: MINUTE
  cors_policy:
    allow_origins:
      - exact: https://app.example.com
    allow_methods:
      - GET
      - POST
      - PUT
      - DELETE

minimal.description: Basic origin pool with single backend
minimal.yaml:
metadata:
  name: backend-pool
  namespace: default
spec:
  origin_servers:
    - public_ip:
        ip: 192.168.1.100
  port: 8080
  loadbalancer_algorithm: ROUND_ROBIN

production.description: Production origin pool with health checks
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: prod-backend
  namespace: production
spec:
  origin_servers:
    - public_name:
        dns_name: backend1.example.com
    - public_name:
        dns_name: backend2.example.com
  port: 443
  use_tls:
    use_host_header_as_sni: {}
    tls_config:
      min_version: TLS12
  healthcheck:
    - name: http-health
      namespace: production
  loadbalancer_algorithm: LEAST_ACTIVE
  endpoint_selection: LOCAL_PREFERRED

advanced.description: Multi-region origin pool with advanced routing
advanced.yaml:
metadata:
  name: global-backend
  namespace: production
spec:
  origin_servers:
    - public_name:
        dns_name: us-backend.example.com
      labels:
        region: us-east
    - public_name:
        dns_name: eu-backend.example.com
      labels:
        region: eu-west
  port: 443
  use_tls:
    use_host_header_as_sni: {}
    tls_config:
      min_version: TLS12
  healthcheck:
    - name: tcp-health
      namespace: production
  loadbalancer_algorithm: ROUND_ROBIN
  endpoint_selection: LOCAL_PREFERRED
  advanced_options:
    connection_timeout: 30000
    idle_timeout: 60000
    max_connections: 10000

minimal.yaml:
metadata:
  name: http-health
  namespace: default
spec:
  http_health_check:
    path: /health
  timeout: 3
  interval: 15
  unhealthy_threshold: 3
  healthy_threshold: 2

production.description: Production health check with custom headers
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: prod-health
  namespace: production
spec:
  http_health_check:
    path: /api/health
    headers:
      x-health-check: "true"
    expected_status_codes:
      - 200
      - 204
  timeout: 5
  interval: 10
  unhealthy_threshold: 2
  healthy_threshold: 3

specifications.title: Vpm And Node Management
specifications.description: APIs for configuring node policies, fleet management, and lifecycle operations. Supports node registration, configuration deployment, and status monitoring across distributed infrastructure.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Node lifecycle, fleet grouping, and orchestration.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Lifecycle control, fleet configuration, and deployment policies for distributed node management.

x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Node configuration for edge device settings

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: vpm_config
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: VPM configuration for virtual platform management

specifications.title: Waf
specifications.description: Signature-based attack detection with customizable blocking responses. Attack type classification, protocol inspection, and AI-driven risk assessment. Exclusion policies override default blocking for trusted traffic. Staged signature testing validates rules before enforcement. Security event metrics track rule hits and blocked requests across namespaces.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-short: Request inspection, attack signatures, and bot mitigation.
specifications.x-f5xc-description-medium: Application firewall rules with signature-based detection. Exclusion policies, blocking pages, and anomaly prevention.

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: app_firewall
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Web Application Firewall policy for HTTP traffic protection

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: service_policy
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Service-level access control and traffic management rules

x-f5xc-primary-resources.name: malicious_user_detection
x-f5xc-primary-resources.description: Automated detection and mitigation of malicious user behavior

minimal.description: Basic WAF policy with default detection

production.description: Production WAF with signature detection and bot defense
production.yaml:
metadata:
  name: prod-waf
  namespace: production
spec:
  blocking: {}
  detection_settings:
    signature_selection_setting:
      default_attack_type_settings: {}
      high_medium_low_accuracy_signatures: {}
    enable_suppression: true
    enable_threat_campaigns: true
  bot_defense_setting:
    policy:
      protected_app_endpoints:
        - metadata:
            name: login
          http_methods:
            - POST
          protocol: HTTPS
          path:
            prefix: /api/login
      js_insert_all_pages:
        javascript_location: AFTER_HEAD
  allow_all_response_codes: false
  default_anonymization: true

advanced.description: Advanced WAF with custom rules and data guard
advanced.yaml:
metadata:
  name: advanced-waf
  namespace: security
spec:
  blocking: {}
  detection_settings:
    signature_selection_setting:
      attack_type_settings:
        - attack_type: ATTACK_TYPE_COMMAND_EXECUTION
          disabled: false
        - attack_type: ATTACK_TYPE_SQL_INJECTION
          disabled: false
        - attack_type: ATTACK_TYPE_CROSS_SITE_SCRIPTING
          disabled: false
      high_medium_low_accuracy_signatures: {}
    enable_suppression: true
    enable_threat_campaigns: true
    violation_settings:
      disabled_violation_types:
        - violation_type: VIOL_FILETYPE
  bot_defense_setting:
    policy:
      protected_app_endpoints:
        - metadata:
            name: api-endpoint
          http_methods:
            - POST
            - PUT
          protocol: HTTPS
          path:
            prefix: /api/
      js_insert_all_pages:
        javascript_location: AFTER_HEAD
  data_guard_rules:
    - name: mask-credit-cards
      path:
        prefix: /
      target_parameters:
        - parameter_name:
            exact_value: credit_card
      apply_data_guard: {}

400.name: Bad Request
400.description: The request was malformed or contains invalid data
common_causes: Invalid JSON syntax in request body

diagnostic_steps.description: Check if request body is valid JSON
Verify all required fields from OpenAPI spec are present
Check string patterns, enum values, and data types
Ensure referenced resources exist and are properly formatted

prevention: Validate JSON with jq or similar tools
Reference OpenAPI spec for required fields and formats

401.name: Unauthorized
401.description: Authentication credentials are missing or invalid

diagnostic_steps.description: Verify Authorization header is present and uses correct format
Ensure token starts with correct prefix (APIToken, Bearer)
Verify token has not expired
diagnostic_steps.command: Check token creation date in console

diagnostic_steps.description: Generate new API token and retry

prevention: Store tokens securely in environment variables

403.name: Forbidden
common_causes: Operation not permitted for user type

diagnostic_steps.description: Verify current user's role assignments
Confirm user has access to target namespace
Verify user has permission for specific resource type
Audit role-based access control configuration

404.name: Not Found
404.description: The requested resource does not exist

diagnostic_steps.description: List all resources of this type to verify existence
Verify operating in correct namespace
Check for typos in resource name
Verify resource was not recently deleted

409.name: Conflict
409.description: The request conflicts with current resource state
common_causes: Resource with same name already exists

diagnostic_steps.description: Verify if resource already exists
Verify resource is not in a transitional state
Check for conflicting dependent resources
Try with a different resource name

prevention: Add timestamps or UUIDs to names

422.name: Unprocessable Entity
422.description: The request is well-formed but contains semantic errors

diagnostic_steps.description: Check response body for specific validation errors
Compare configuration against documentation requirements
Verify referenced resources meet all requirements
Check field-level constraints and requirements

429.name: Too Many Requests
common_causes: Too many requests in time window

diagnostic_steps.description: Note the suggested wait time from response headers
Count requests made in recent time window
Add exponential backoff between requests
Wait a moment and retry the request
Verify F5 XC service health status
Try with minimal configuration
If persistent, open support ticket with request ID
Wait and retry the request
Verify network connectivity to API endpoint
Verify F5 XC service availability

503.name: Service Unavailable

diagnostic_steps.description: Note suggested retry time if present
Implement exponential backoff
Verify service status for maintenance windows

prevention: Build in retry logic with backoff

504.name: Gateway Timeout
504.description: Request timed out waiting for response

diagnostic_steps.description: Try with smaller request payload
For async operations, check status separately
If client-controlled, increase timeout

prevention: Break large operations into smaller batches

dns_zone.resolution: Verify DNS record format matches record type requirements
Use existing zone or delete before recreation

http_loadbalancer.resolution: Create the referenced origin pool before creating the load balancer
Verify certificate format and upload a valid certificate first
Use a unique name or delete the existing load balancer

origin_pool.resolution: Specify a valid port number between 1-65535
Verify IP address format or DNS name resolution

waf.resolution: Validate WAF rule syntax against rule specification
Detach existing WAF policy before attaching new one
